# criblio_key (Resource)

Key Resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "criblio_key" "my_key" {
  algorithm   = "aes-256-cbc"
  description = "My Key Metadata"
  expires     = 1759325416
  group_id    = "default"
  id          = "key-001"
  keyclass    = 0
  kms         = "local"
  use_iv      = true
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `group_id` (String) The consumer group to which this instance belongs. Defaults to 'default'.
- `id` (String) The id of this key metadata entity instance

### Optional

- `algorithm` (String) Default: "aes-256-cbc"; must be one of ["aes-256-cbc", "aes-256-gcm"]
- `description` (String)
- `expires` (Number)
- `keyclass` (Number) Default: 0
- `kms` (String) Default: "local"; must be "local"
- `use_iv` (Boolean) Seed encryption with a [nonce](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptographic_nonce) to make the key more random and unique. Must be enabled with the aes-256-gcm algorithm. Default: false

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

In Terraform v1.5.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `id` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = criblio_key.my_criblio_key
  id = jsonencode({
    group_id = "default"
    id = "key-001"
    key_id = "myKeyId"
  })
}
```

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import criblio_key.my_criblio_key '{"group_id": "default", "id": "key-001", "key_id": "myKeyId"}'
```
